reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just one luxurious night at Las Brisas thinking we might want some high-end comfort at the end of our quick trip through Mexico. Boy, what a treat this place was! We're not big fans of resort areas, but we loved this hotel. The architecture and design elements were amazing, the view was spectacular, and the service was great. We had a brief glitch at check-in when we were given a room that hadn't been cleaned yet, but no big deal -- that happens sometimes, and we were just grateful that they were letting us check in at all because we arrived considerably before check-in was allowed. They immediately moved us to a prepared room, and later sent a bottle of champagne to the room (I presume to apologize for the inconvenience, even though there was none). The grounds are beautiful. The way the hotel is built, guests in effect have their own private cove, and it's lovely. It's quite perfect for people who don't need the hubbub of a true resort, because you are isolated from Ixtapa. But, if you want the hubbub, a quick cab ride can get you there. Some of the food was lackluster (a poolside lunch was really fairly typical of hotel food, which is a shame for the price), but other food was memorable (the $20 US breakfast buffet that includes tip). We would still be there tonight, if it were at all possible!
reviews.title: Wonderful treat, and not outlandishly expensive

reviews.text: We got our vacation package through Worry Free Vacations. Those guys are great. $2 Caronas on the bus & your thinkin "cool - this will be an awsome trip". SKREEEEEECH! You get down the the beach or pool, & they are $5.50 each. Yikes. I could not believe the prices. The breakfast buffet is $20. I think most of the guests did the all enclusive. I guess we will check into that next time. We probably could of had it paid for our first day there.
reviews.title: Nice Place & VERY EXPENSIVE
Go for the Jr Suite Upgrade! Your own jacuzzi tub on the outdoor deck...
reviews.text: So, we ended up going to town most of the time to eat. The restaurants by Sr. Frogs were pretty much resonable. And if you want to go shopping for groceries (which you pretty much have to do to make it through the week, sneek in cuz there's a sign that says no beverages or food is permitted to bring in), go to The Walmart in Zeewhat. It's called something else, but it is owned by Walmart. You can take a bus there for 70 cents, but you will need to catch the bus on the road which is a hike, expecially with groceries. My tip for you is to take the bus there, & taxi back, then the taxi will take you to the entrance.

reviews.title: Beautiful, Unpretentious and Great Service
reviews.text: Taxi prices are pretty much set.
$4.00 to town (Ixtapa)
reviews.title: Las Brisas - A jewel by the sea!

likes.disliked: — The stone driveway was murder in a taxi!

reviews.title: Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful!!!
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we knew we'd done well! The place is amazing! Had a junior suite, 22nd floor with jacuzzi on terrace. Very private!! Very, very nice room. Great restaurants for breakfast and lunch. Never had dinner there except room service, which was very good. Nice beach, 4 pools, very few children, very friendly staff. Don't do all inclusive; too many wonderful places to explore! Up the hill is Villa de la Selva, a MUST for a magnificent sunset dinner, as well as La Casa Que Canta, a $12 cab ride into Zihuatanejo for an even more romantic sunset dinner. The place is truly breathtaking! Great silver shopping at Ixtapa Commercial. Beautiful jewelry, great prices. Las Brisas is a little slice of heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week long stay at Las Brisas and are already planning a trip for 2009. We stayed in a room on the 21st floor as part of the Beach Club plan which included a complimentary Continental breakfast and a free cocktail and appetizer buffet from 6:00 to 7:00 PM. We plan to do the Beach Club plan again as we felt we got more than our money's worth, plus, the view from the higher floors is spectacular.
reviews.title: We can't wait to go back!

likes.liked: — The private decks with unobstructed views
likes.disliked: — The Lobby Bar prices were outrageous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About the Beach Club plan: the breakfast, available from 7:00 to 11:00 AM, offered a variety of cereals, pastries, juices, and two hot items that changed daily. The only other breakfast option we found at the hotel was a $20 per person breakfast buffet. The cocktail/appetizer buffet offered wine, Mexican beer, pina coladas and margaritas for drinks, and chips, guacamole, salsa, and special appetizers that changed daily, plus a sweet pastry.
reviews.title: All inclusive is a must!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach Club buffet service is top notch and we liked the intimate venue. We met other travelers and compared notes on things to do and places to eat.
reviews.title: beautiful place, outrageous pricing

reviews.text: The rooms at Las Brisas are generously sized and the private decks with their unobstructed sunset views are a real bonus. The chairs and table on the deck are teak, not plastic. The beds are very comfortable, amongst the most comfortable I've slept on at a hotel. The bathroom is roomy and features a spacious shower, but my one quibble is that the water pressure is very low and the hot water was a tad intermittent.
reviews.title: My kid loved it!

likes.liked: — private beach, lovely grounds, large rooms with large balconies
likes.disliked: — not within easy walking distance of anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Las Brisas for our 25th wedding anniversary. From the reviews and the websites, I built up great expectation for the place. Maybe that's the only problem in my mediocre review of the place as I constructed an artificially high platform from which it could only fall. Also perhaps because the arcitecture is suberb for what it is...but just not my style. So in a way, my lower rating for this place may only be all about me.
reviews.title: Really wanted to love it but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lets start with ...
reviews.title: Pros outweigh cons plus a few hints

likes.liked: — The ocean, the views, the fine service without a bunch of glitz/glam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "THE GOOD".
reviews.title: Wonderful Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff. All friendly and as personal as personal can be when you're dealing with hundreds of people changing every week. Don't expect them to remember you, but be delighted if they do as this is a BIG place with lots of changing faces.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons to Las Brisas Ixtapa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic private balconies. The hammocks are cool although we hung it up after the third day as ducking under it everytime you want to go to the patio was a bit fussy. The design of the patios give enough privacy that you can readily wander about in you underwear or less if you feel so inclined. Of course, the views on all floors (except 10 and 11 that have trees in front) are wonderful to watch the sun or the moon go down, the cruise ships, container ships and fishing boats go by.
reviews.title: Deserving Of It's #1 Ranking
nice resort hotel
reviews.text: I normally stay in hostels and go the backpacker route, but after a difficult event in my life, I decided I needed to go lie on a beach and be pampered. I really enjoyed my time at Las Brisas. It was a beautiful room. I loved the very private balcony with a hammock. I was on the 11th floor, which is pretty close to the beach, but doesn't have much of a view of the beach because of the trees. The lobby bar is beautiful. People were generally nice. They do seem to come by at odd hours. Someone came by at 10pm to see if I needed more towels. And a maid came by at 7:30am the day I was checking out. It is kind of far from town, which makes it harder if you're trying not to taxi everywhere and I found the front desk staff not that helpful when asking about where to catch the bus. I did feel like they thought I was a bit of a freak for leaving the hotel on foot and for traveling alone! but that's probably the case in most of these resort hotels.

reviews.title: Thumbs up for Las Brisas
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a relaxing two week stay at Las Brisas. In my opinion, the previous two reviews are very accurate. Las Brisas is architectually stunning. It's so well laid out that you forget it is a fairly large hotel. The private balcony with a spectacular ocean view is worth the price of the room alone. We were on the 15th floor and had a great view. I think rooms on the lowest floors would have views compromised by trees (floors 10 and 11, perhaps). We also requested a room that was in the west wing of the hotel. These rooms are closer to the stairs leading to the pool area ( a lovely, lush walk) and the restaurants. Our room was very clean and nicely appointed. The shower leaked water onto the floor at times, but this is a minor complaint. The mattress was too hard for my husband, so we rectified this by sleeping on top of the down duvet, instead of under it (which was sometimes too hot, anyway). The service during our stay was exemplary - I wish we could get service like this more often in Canada! We went with the all inclusive plan through Air Canada. It is a great deal, even if you choose to eat dinner outside the hotel. Food is very expensive at Las Brisas ($ 4.50 for a large bottle of water, $ 5 for drinks, $ 10 for guacamole etc). We got room service for breakfast one day, and the bill was almost eighty dollars! So, the all inclusive paid for itself even if we just had breakfast, lunch and snacks at the hotel. It also eliminated the added stress of worrying about how much we were spending every time we wanted to order something. We loved the Brisas II for dinners when we did choose to eat at the resort. The Italian restaurant is very good, too. Make sure to try the mango flambe for dessert. It's not on the menu, but you can request it. The only caveat to this glowing review is that there are conventions held at this hotel. During our stay, a large Mexican group took over the hotel for a few days and disrupted the laid back touristy ambience that usually prevailed. Loud music one night, microphones on the beach, and very busy at breakfast. Not good. On our next trip to the Brisas, we will check with the concierge, in advance, and try to work around any large gatherings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Las Brisas de Ixtapa is a lovely hotel - prior to staying there, our favorite hotel was Hilton Checkers in downtown LA.
reviews.title: Las Brisas is fabulous and I am somewhat picky

likes.disliked: — The bed was very hard and the restaurants were pricey.

reviews.title: Las Brisas is Charming, Romantic & Relaxing!
reviews.text: The service is top notch at Las Brisas, the grounds are jungley with windy stone and paved paths (lots of gorgeous stairs, but there are elevators too) and the restaurants are very good (though pricey). There is a great breakfast buffet for $20/person (tip included) with lots of fresh fruit, eggs cooked to order, and Mexican meats and pastries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is technically public, though since it is only accessible from the hotel it is essentially private which means that there aren't peddlers. Although there is undertow, we were able to play in the surf a lot without drowning (and we are lousy swimmers). If you prefer a waveless experience, there are several very clean outdoor swimming pools surrounded by all sorts of beautiful foliage and sporting fountains. At least one of the pools is for adults only.
reviews.title: A week of R&R

likes.disliked: — No lunch and supper buffet available
